meanings.definition: A small freshwater fish of the genus Fundulus.
meanings.sent1: I saw a colorful killie swimming in the pond.
meanings.sent2: The killie darted between the rocks in the stream.
meanings.sent3: The curious killie decided to explore the entire aquarium.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts swam like a school of killie, moving swiftly and gracefully.
meanings.sent5: The shimmering scales of the killie caught the sunlight, creating a beautiful sight.

meanings.definition: A type of bait used in fishing.
meanings.sent1: The fisherman used a small killie as bait to catch a big fish.
meanings.sent2: The angler carefully hooked the killie onto the fishing line.
meanings.sent3: The clever fish avoided the tempting killie bait.
meanings.sent4: The hungry fish eyed the killie bait with suspicion.
meanings.sent5: The scent of the fresh killie bait attracted many fish to the area.

meanings.sent1: The hunter aimed carefully to killie the target with one shot.
meanings.sent2: The villain plotted to killie the hero and take over the kingdom.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy magician accidentally tried to killie a rabbit instead of making it disappear.
meanings.sent4: The storm seemed to killie the last remnants of hope in the weary traveler.
meanings.sent5: The harsh words seemed to killie the friendship between the two friends.
